page.title: 19THE 'STORY' OF FELON'S OAK.
page.content: At the crossroads of Forches Lane and Greenland Lane near Croydon Hall there was an old oak tree. People who committed crimes used to be hung by a very strong rope on the branches of the oak till they were dead and when the rope broke they fell down on the track. The tree has stood for about 300 years until it was cut down very recently. In that time it became called Felons Oak.Most villagers said there was a ring of power around it and if you went to it after 8 o'clock at night a cloak of darkness would come over you and your neck would begin to tingle. So people stayed well away. Now a new tree has been planted.If you put your head to the old stump of the oak you can still hear the rattle of chains.
